com.example.foodtracker3

Class DatabaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.example.foodtracker3.DatabaseHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DatabaseHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    A helper class for managing app-specific SQLite database operations.
    Version:
    1.0.0 Jun 7, 2020
    Author:
    Andrew Dineen, Aidan Fallstorm, Rick Patneaude, Eli Storlie, Marco Villafana

    • Method Detail

      • createTempDB

        public static DatabaseHelper createTempDB(@Nullable
                                          android.content.Context context)
        Create an in-memory memory database, which ceases to exist once the connection is closed. ** Currently only used for unit testing. **
        Parameters:
        context - The current context.
        Returns:
        A new DatabaseHelper object for an in-memory database.

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Builds a SQLiteDatabase. Creates tables and inserts default records. This gets called after a call to getReadableDatabase() or getWritableDatabase() ONLY if the database doesn't already exist. If the database already exists, then that database will be opened and used, and this code will not be called.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - The SQLiteDatabase being affected.

      • onConfigure

        public void onConfigure(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Handles database configurations, called after database has been created.
        Overrides:
        onConfigure in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - The SQLiteDatabase whose configurations are being affected.

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                      int oldVersion,
                      int newVersion)
        Handles any necessary data migration whenever database version number changes. It prevents old app versions from breaking when you change database design.
        Specified by:
        onUpgrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - The SQLiteDatabase whose version has changed.
        oldVersion - Existing database version number.
        newVersion - New database version number.
